content:
Diagnosis:		Gastric adenocarcinoma with mixed features

Management:		Total gastrectomy 15 Jan 2024
		Adjuvant CAPOX chemotherapy completed 20 Apr 2024

Histology:		pT3N2M0 mixed type adenocarcinoma
		MMR deficient, HER2 2+ (FISH negative)
		5/15 lymph nodes positive

Current Situation:	End of treatment review

[redacted name] attended clinic today following completion of 6 cycles of adjuvant CAPOX chemotherapy. She has managed the treatment well with only grade 1 neuropathy affecting fingertips which is now improving. Her appetite remains good with stable weight at 65kg. Performance status is 0. Blood tests show stable parameters with normal CEA.

On examination, surgical wounds are well healed with no concerning features. No evidence of disease recurrence.

I have discussed completion of treatment and explained the surveillance plan. She will have 3-monthly clinic reviews for the first year with CEA measurements. CT scan is arranged for 3 months' time. She understands to contact us if any new symptoms develop. Written information about post-treatment surveillance has been provided.

cancer_timeline.value: Completed 6 cycles of adjuvant CAPOX chemotherapy

patient_facts.value: surgical wounds well healed with no concerning features

status_updates.value: Stage III gastric cancer post surgery and adjuvant chemotherapy. Completed planned treatment with good tolerance and currently no evidence of recurrence
Grade 1 peripheral neuropathy affecting fingertips, improving
Completed planned course of 6 cycles adjuvant CAPOX chemotherapy
3-monthly clinic reviews with CEA measurements for first year
